data.title: Timmins Daily Press
data.meta_description: Helene Savage passed away. This is the full obituary where you can express condolences and share memories. Published in the Timmins Daily Press on 2021-02-18.
data.text:
It's with heavy hearts that the Savage family announces the passing of Helene at the Golden Manor on Sunday, February 14, 2021 at the age of 94 years. Helene was the cherished wife of John Savage whom predeceased her in 2013. Loving mother of Robert (Murielle) of New Brunswick, Raymond (June) of Surrey B.C and Madeleine of Maple Ridge B.C. Beloved grandmother to Luc, Kim, Julie, Steven, Christine, Jennifer and Troy. Helene was also the great grandmother of Janelle, Kalie , Nichola, Alexis, Maelle, Aurelie, Justine, William, Carter, Tyrone, Tamaya and Léo. Great-great grandmother of Oceanie. Helene will also be missed by a very special long time family friend Linda Savage (Wayne) of Timmins. She is survived by her sister Rose in PEI, her sister-in-law Gwen Savage and many nieces and nephews. Predeceased by her siblings Melina, Joe, Wilfred, Marie, Louis and Florence. Special thank you to Wanda and Louis for always being there and helping Helene over the years. Love you guys. In light of the current coronavirus pandemic, in efforts to protect the public and the family, no service or visitation will take place. Remembrance donations to the charity of your choice would be greatly appreciated. The funeral arrangements are entrusted with the MIRON-WILSON FUNERAL HOME, CREMATION AND RECEPTION CENTRE 150 Balsam St. S. Timmins. To make credit card online donations or condolences, please visit

Published online February 18, 2021

Note: These are general guidelines; some florists may not be able to operate within these timelines. During peak periods such as Valentine’s Day, Memorial Day and most holidays, florists are not always able to keep up to demand. Tribute will contact you if there are any issues.

Plant a tree: How does it work

When your purchase is complete, a post will be made on the tribute wall of the deceased signifying the planting of a memorial tree.

An official certificate recognizing your purchase will be included with your email receipt. You can then forward the email to the family or print it and give it to them personally.

After an order is placed, our forestry partners will plant the tree in the area of greatest need (nearest the funeral home), according to the planting schedule for the year.

Due to seasonal conditions, the tree planting takes place during the spring and summer.

Tree Planting Timeline

Orders placed in:

January - May

Planting will take place in Spring or Summer of the same year.

June - December

Planting will take place in Spring of the following year.
